Key Arguments: The legislation does not appropriately balance freedom of expression.
The bill is seen as an overreach of control in a democratic society.
There is skepticism about who defines misinformation and disinformation.
Historical examples show that what is initially considered misinformation can later be proven true.
The bill could suppress scientific inquiry and open discussion.
Main Themes: Scientific inquiry and evolution of knowledge
Notable Quotes: This draft Bill does NOT strike an appropriate balance on freedom of expression!
It is totally abhorrent to propose such control over constituents!
Science is based on hypotheses, testing and researching, proving and disproving.
Suppression of open discussion has no place in a democratic society!
